{{cpp/chrono/year_month_weekday/title|ok}}
{{cpp/chrono/year_month_weekday/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|since=c++20|
constexpr bool ok() const noexcept;
}}
{{dcl end}}
Checks if this {{tt|year_month_weekday}} object represents a valid date.

===Return value===
{{c|true}} if this {{tt|year_month_weekday}} object represents a valid date, that is, {{c|year().ok() &amp;&amp; month().ok() &amp;&amp; weekday_indexed().ok()}} is {{c|true}} and there are at least {{rlpf|accessors|index}} {{rlpf|accessors|weekday}}s in the specified year and month. Otherwise {{c|false}}.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;cassert&gt;
#include &lt;chrono&gt;

int main()
{
    auto ymwdi{std::chrono::Wednesday[1]/1/2021};
    assert(ymwdi.ok());
    ymwdi = std::chrono::year(2021)/std::chrono::month(1)/std::chrono::Wednesday[42];
    assert(!ymwdi.ok());
}
}}
